channel.title: CVE Feed for Lenovo -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Lenovo -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-8326|2024-08-04T09:56:28.317Z -- lenovo -- drivers%20management
item.description: An unquoted service path vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Drivers Management prior to version 2.7.1128.1046 that could allow an authenticated user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-8319|2024-08-04T09:56:28.339Z -- lenovo -- lenovo%20system%20interface%20foundation
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo System Interface Foundation prior to version 1.1.19.3 that could allow an authenticated user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-8332|2024-08-04T09:56:28.331Z -- lenovo -- system%20x
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the SMI callback function used in the legacy BIOS mode USB drivers in some legacy Lenovo and IBM System x servers may allow arbitrary code execution. Servers operating in UEFI mode are not affected.

item.title: CVE-2020-8321|2024-08-04T09:56:28.334Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the SMI callback function used in the System Lock Preinstallation driver in some Lenovo Notebook and ThinkStation models may allow arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-8330|2024-08-04T09:56:28.302Z -- lenovo -- printer%20lj4010dn
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the firmware prior to version 1.01 used in Lenovo Printer LJ4010DN that could be triggered by a remote user sending a crafted packet to the device, preventing subsequent print jobs until the printer is rebooted.

item.title: CVE-2020-8334|2024-08-04T09:56:28.321Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: The BIOS tamper detection mechanism was not triggered in Lenovo ThinkPad T495s, X395, T495, A485, A285, A475, A275 which may allow for unauthorized access.

item.title: CVE-2021-42852|2024-08-04T03:38:50.310Z -- lenovo -- personal%20cloud%20storage%20a1
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Personal Cloud Storage devices that could allow an authenticated user to execute operating system commands by sending a crafted packet to the device.

item.title: CVE-2021-42848|2024-08-04T03:38:50.160Z -- lenovo -- personal%20cloud%20storage%20a1
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Personal Cloud Storage devices that could allow an unauthenticated user to retrieve device and networking details.

item.title: CVE-2020-8354|2024-08-04T09:56:28.369Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the SMI callback function used in the VariableServiceSmm driver in some Lenovo Notebook models may allow arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-8346|2024-08-04T09:56:28.508Z -- lenovo -- system%20interface%20foundation
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Vantage component called Lenovo System Interface Foundation prior to version 1.1.19.5 that could allow configuration files to be written to non-standard locations.

item.title: CVE-2020-8355|2024-08-04T09:56:28.414Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: An internal product security audit of Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) prior to version 3.1.0 discovered the Windows OS credentials provided by the LXCA user to perform driver updates of managed systems may be captured in the First Failure Data Capture (FFDC) service log if the service log is generated while managed endpoints are updating. The service log is only generated when requested by a privileged LXCA user and it is only accessible to the privileged LXCA user that requested the file and is then deleted.

item.title: CVE-2020-8342|2024-08-04T09:56:28.350Z -- lenovo -- system%20update
item.description: A race condition vulnerability was reported in Lenovo System Update prior to version 5.07.0106 that could allow escalation of privilege.

item.title: CVE-2020-8351|2024-08-04T09:56:28.396Z -- lenovo -- pcmanager
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PCManager prior to version 3.0.50.9162 that could allow an authenticated user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2021-42849|2024-08-04T03:38:50.219Z -- lenovo -- personal%20cloud%20storage%20a1
item.description: A weak default password for the serial port was reported in some Lenovo Personal Cloud Storage devices that could allow unauthorized device access to an attacker with physical access.

item.title: CVE-2020-8320|2024-08-04T09:56:28.434Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: An internal shell was included in BIOS image in some ThinkPad models that could allow escalation of privilege.

item.title: CVE-2020-8336|2024-08-04T09:56:28.349Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: Lenovo implemented Intel CSME Anti-rollback ARB protections on some ThinkPad models to prevent roll back of CSME Firmware in flash.

item.title: CVE-2020-8322|2024-08-04T09:56:28.318Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the SMI callback function used in the Legacy USB driver in some Lenovo Notebook and ThinkStation models may allow arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-8318|2024-08-04T09:56:28.350Z -- lenovo -- lenovosystemupdateplugin%20for%20lenovo%20system%20interface%20foundation
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in the LenovoSystemUpdatePlugin for Lenovo System Interface Foundation prior to version that could allow an authenticated user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-8338|2024-08-04T09:56:28.465Z -- lenovo -- diagnostics
item.description: A DLL search path vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Diagnostics prior to version 4.35.4 that could allow a user with local access to execute code on the system.

item.title: CVE-2020-8352|2024-08-04T09:56:28.322Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: In some Lenovo Desktop models, the Configuration Change Detection BIOS setting failed to detect SATA configuration changes.

item.title: CVE-2020-8327|2024-08-04T09:56:28.313Z -- lenovo -- vantage
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in LenovoBatteryGaugePackage for Lenovo System Interface Foundation bundled in Lenovo Vantage prior to version 10.2003.10.0 that could allow an authenticated user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-8341|2024-08-04T09:56:28.358Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad
item.description: In Lenovo systems, SMM BIOS Write Protection is used to prevent writes to SPI Flash. While this provides sufficient protection, an additional layer of protection is provided by SPI Protected Range Registers (PRx). After resuming from S3 sleep mode in various versions of BIOS for some Lenovo ThinkPad systems, the PRx is not set. This does not impact the SMM BIOS Write Protection, which keeps systems protected.

item.title: CVE-2020-8350|2024-08-04T09:56:28.430Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20stack%20wireless%20router%20firmware
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was reported in Lenovo ThinkPad Stack Wireless Router firmware version 1.1.3.4 that could allow escalation of privilege.

item.title: CVE-2020-8357|2024-08-04T09:56:28.321Z -- lenovo -- pcmanager
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PCManager, prior to version 3.0.200.2042, that could allow configuration files to be written to non-standard locations.

item.title: CVE-2020-8353|2024-08-04T09:56:28.333Z -- lenovo -- desktop%20and%20workstation%20systems
item.description: Prior to August 10, 2020, some Lenovo Desktop and Workstation systems were shipped with the Embedded Host Based Configuration (EHBC) feature of Intel AMT enabled. This could allow an administrative user with local access to configure Intel AMT.

item.title: CVE-2020-8348|2024-08-04T09:56:28.343Z -- lenovo -- enterprise%20network%20disk
item.description: A DOM-based cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Enterprise Network Disk prior to version 6.1 patch 6 hotfix 4 that could allow execution of code in an authenticated user's current browser session if a crafted url is visited, possibly through phishing.

item.title: CVE-2020-8349|2024-08-04T09:56:28.342Z -- lenovo -- cloud%20networking%20operating%20system%20%28cnos%29
item.description: An internal security review has identified an unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability in Cloud Networking Operating System (CNOS)’ optional REST API management interface. This interface is disabled by default and not vulnerable unless enabled. When enabled, it is only vulnerable where attached to a VRF and as allowed by defined ACLs. Lenovo strongly recommends upgrading to a non-vulnerable CNOS release. Where not possible, Lenovo recommends disabling the REST API management interface or restricting access to the management VRF and further limiting access to authorized management stations via ACL.

item.title: CVE-2020-8329|2024-08-04T09:56:28.339Z -- lenovo -- printer%20lj4010dn
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the firmware prior to version 1.01 used in Lenovo Printer LJ4010DN that could be triggered by a remote user sending a crafted packet to the device, causing an error to be displayed and preventing printer from functioning until the printer is rebooted.

item.title: CVE-2020-8324|2024-08-04T09:56:28.363Z -- lenovo -- lenovoappscenariopluginsystem%20for%20lenovo%20system%20interface%20foundation
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in LenovoAppScenarioPluginSystem for Lenovo System Interface Foundation prior to version 1.2.184.31 that could allow unsigned DLL files to be executed.

item.title: CVE-2020-8316|2024-08-04T09:56:28.336Z -- lenovo -- vantage
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Vantage prior to version 10.2003.10.0 that could allow an authenticated user to read files on the system with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-8335|2024-08-04T09:56:28.331Z -- lenovo -- thinkpad%20a285%20bios
item.description: The BIOS tamper detection mechanism was not triggered in Lenovo ThinkPad A285, BIOS versions up to r0xuj70w; A485, BIOS versions up to r0wuj65w; T495 BIOS versions up to r12uj55w; T495s/X395, BIOS versions up to r13uj47w, while the emergency-reset button is pressed which may allow for unauthorized access.

item.title: CVE-2020-8345|2024-08-04T09:56:28.341Z -- lenovo -- vantage%20hardwarescan%20plugin
item.description: A DLL search path vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo HardwareScan Plugin for the Lenovo Vantage hardware scan feature prior to version 1.0.46.11 that could allow escalation of privilege.

item.title: CVE-2020-8347|2024-08-04T09:56:28.450Z -- lenovo -- enterprise%20network%20disk
item.description: A reflective cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Enterprise Network Disk prior to version 6.1 patch 6 hotfix 4 that could allow execution of code in an authenticated user's browser if a crafted url is visited, possibly through phishing.

item.title: CVE-2020-8333|2024-08-04T09:56:28.329Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the SMI callback function used in the EEPROM driver in some Lenovo Desktops and ThinkStation models may allow arbitrary code execution

item.title: CVE-2021-42851|2024-08-04T03:38:50.248Z -- lenovo -- personal%20cloud%20storage%20a1
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Personal Cloud Storage devices that could allow an unauthenticated user to create a standard user account.

A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability was discovered in the legacy IBM and Lenovo System x IMM2 (Integrated Management Module 2), prior to version 5.60, embedded Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) web interface during an internal security review. This vulnerability could allow JavaScript code to be executed in the user's web browser if the user is convinced to visit a crafted URL, possibly through phishing. Successful exploitation requires specific knowledge about the user’s network to be included in the crafted URL. Impact is limited to the normal access restrictions and permissions of the user clicking the crafted URL, and subject to the user being able to connect to and already being authenticated to IMM2 or other systems. The JavaScript code is not executed on IMM2 itself.

item.title: CVE-2021-42850|2024-08-04T03:38:50.139Z -- lenovo -- personal%20cloud%20storage%20a1
item.description: A weak default administrator password for the web interface and serial port was reported in some Lenovo Personal Cloud Storage devices that could allow unauthorized device access to an attacker with physical or local network access.

item.title: CVE-2020-8337|2024-08-04T09:56:28.336Z -- lenovo -- synaptics%20smart%20audio%20uwp%20app
item.description: An unquoted search path vulnerability was reported in versions prior to 1.0.83.0 of the Synaptics Smart Audio UWP app associated with the DCHU audio drivers on Lenovo platforms that could allow an administrative user to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2020-8356|2024-08-04T09:56:28.335Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20orchestrator
item.description: An internal product security audit of LXCO, prior to version 1.2.2, discovered that optional passwords, if specified, for the Syslog and SMTP forwarders are written to an internal LXCO log file in clear text. Affected logs are captured in the First Failure Data Capture (FFDC) service log. The FFDC service log is only generated when requested by a privileged LXCO user and it is only accessible to the privileged LXCO user that requested the file.

item.title: CVE-2020-8323|2024-08-04T09:56:28.326Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability in the SMI callback function used in the Legacy SD driver in some Lenovo ThinkPad, ThinkStation, and Lenovo Notebook models may allow arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-8317|2024-08-04T09:56:28.388Z -- lenovo -- drivers%20management
item.description: A DLL search path vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Drivers Management prior to version 2.7.1128.1046 that could allow an authenticated user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2019-6198|2024-08-02T18:11:26.320Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager prior to version 2.8.90.11211 that could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2023-5912|2024-08-02T08:14:24.668Z -- lenovo -- notebook%20bios
item.description: A potential memory leakage vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Notebook products that may allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2024-38509|2024-08-02T04:12:24.979Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted IPMI command.

item.title: CVE-2024-38512|2024-08-02T04:12:25.173Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted IPMI commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-38511|2024-08-02T04:12:25.141Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in an upload processing functionality of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38510|2024-08-02T04:12:24.688Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the SSH captive command shell interface that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38508|2024-08-02T04:12:25.569Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the web interface or SSH captive command shell interface of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via a specially crafted request.

item.title: CVE-2024-4696|2024-08-01T20:47:41.519Z -- lenovo -- service%20bridge
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Service Bridge prior to version 5.0.2.17 that could allow operating system commands to be executed if a specially crafted link is visited.

item.title: CVE-2024-3286|2024-08-01T20:05:08.381Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was identified in some Lenovo printers that could allow an unauthenticated user to trigger a device restart by sending a specially crafted web request.

item.title: CVE-2024-4786|2024-08-01T20:55:08.718Z -- lenovo -- tab%20k10
item.description: An improper validation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Tab K10 that could allow a specially crafted application to keep the device on.

item.title: CVE-2017-3772|2024-08-01T15:04:36.566Z -- lenovo -- pc%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager versions prior to 2.6.40.3154 that could allow an attacker to cause a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2023-25493|2024-07-31T19:31:26.044Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2024-38509|2024-07-27T17:21:01.331Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted IPMI command.

item.title: CVE-2024-38512|2024-07-27T17:16:58.109Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted IPMI commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-38511|2024-07-27T17:19:56.955Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in an upload processing functionality of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38510|2024-07-27T17:20:24.112Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the SSH captive command shell interface that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-38508|2024-07-27T17:21:36.848Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the web interface or SSH captive command shell interface of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via a specially crafted request.

item.title: CVE-2024-23591|2024-07-26T15:09:33.128Z -- lenovo -- thinksystem%20sr670%20v2
item.description:
ThinkSystem SR670V2 servers manufactured from approximately June 2021 to July 2023 were left in Manufacturing Mode which could allow
an attacker with privileged logical access to the host or physical access to server internals to modify or disable Intel Boot Guard firmware integrity, SPS security, and other SPS configuration setting. The server’s NIST SP 800-193-compliant Platform Firmware Resiliency (PFR) security subsystem significantly mitigates this issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-4855|2024-07-09T20:00:42.214Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.title: CVE-2023-4857|2024-07-09T19:59:02.276Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4856|2024-07-09T17:42:49.691Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-06-20T15:59:08.416Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-06-20T15:57:13.662Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-06-20T15:47:17.193Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2024-4696|2024-06-13T20:01:18.145Z -- lenovo -- service%20bridge
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Service Bridge prior to version 5.0.2.17 that could allow operating system commands to be executed if a specially crafted link is visited.

item.title: CVE-2024-2659|2024-04-15T18:00:12.275Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute system commands when performing a specific administrative function.

item.title: CVE-2024-3286|2024-05-16T17:21:21.869Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was identified in some Lenovo printers that could allow an unauthenticated user to trigger a device restart by sending a specially crafted web request.

item.title: CVE-2024-23591|2024-02-20T21:47:49.570Z -- lenovo -- thinksystem%20sr670%20v2
item.description:
ThinkSystem SR670V2 servers manufactured from approximately June 2021 to July 2023 were left in Manufacturing Mode which could allow
an attacker with privileged logical access to the host or physical access to server internals to modify or disable Intel Boot Guard firmware integrity, SPS security, and other SPS configuration setting. The server’s NIST SP 800-193-compliant Platform Firmware Resiliency (PFR) security subsystem significantly mitigates this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23593|2024-06-04T17:45:57.103Z -- lenovo -- windows%207%20and%208%20pc%20preloads
item.description:
A vulnerability was reported
in a system recovery bootloader that was part of the Lenovo preloaded Windows 7 and 8 operating systems from 2012 to 2014
that could allow a privileged attacker with local access to modify the boot manager and escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-23592|2024-04-05T20:46:20.996Z -- lenovo -- synaptics%20fingerprint%20readers
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was reported in Lenovo devices with Synaptics fingerprint readers that could allow an attacker with physical access to replay fingerprints and bypass Windows Hello authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-23594|2024-04-15T18:01:23.230Z -- lenovo -- windows%207%20and%208%20pc%20preloads
item.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported
in a system recovery bootloader that was part of the Lenovo preloaded Windows 7 and 8 operating systems from 2012 to 2014
that could allow a privileged attacker with local access to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-04-05T20:47:01.657Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27910|2024-04-05T20:46:55.352Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to reboot the printer without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-04-05T20:46:46.021Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2024-27908|2024-06-04T17:47:05.996Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-04-05T20:47:09.905Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in the SSH captive command shell interface that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.title: CVE-2024-4786|2024-07-26T19:45:41.260Z -- lenovo -- tab%20k10
item.description: An improper validation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Tab K10 that could allow a specially crafted application to keep the device on.

item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in an upload processing functionality of XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted file uploads.

item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to perform command injection via specially crafted IPMI commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-38509|2024-07-26T19:45:01.471Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20controller
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered in XCC that could allow an authenticated XCC user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted IPMI command.

item.description: An improper validation vulnerability was reported in the Lenovo Tab K10 that could allow a specially crafted application to keep the device on.

item.description: A path hijacking vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Driver Manager prior to version 3.1.1307.1308 that could allow a local user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager prior to version 2.8.90.11211 that could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges.

item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager prior to version 2.8.90.11211 that could allow a local attacker to escalate privileges.

item.description: A vulnerability was reported in Lenovo PC Manager versions prior to 2.6.40.3154 that could allow an attacker to cause a system reboot.

item.description: A path hijacking vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Driver Manager prior to version 3.1.1307.1308 that could allow a local user to execute code with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-2659|2024-08-01T19:18:48.140Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute system commands when performing a specific administrative function.

item.title: CVE-2024-27910|2024-08-02T00:41:55.954Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to reboot the printer without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-08-02T00:41:55.827Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-08-02T00:41:55.749Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.title: CVE-2024-27908|2024-08-02T00:41:55.790Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-08-02T00:41:55.786Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2023-4856|2024-08-02T07:38:00.888Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2023-4855|2024-08-02T07:38:00.762Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.title: CVE-2023-4605|2024-08-02T07:31:06.648Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.description: A potential vulnerability were reported in the BIOS of some Desktop, Smart Edge, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2023-25493|2024-08-02T11:25:18.371Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.
